As your baby develops, both the number and 
type of movements will change with your 
babyâ€™s activity pattern. Usually, afternoon and 
evening periods are times of peak activity 
for your baby. During both day and night, 
your baby has sleep periods that mostly last 
between 20 and 40 minutes, and are rarely 
longer than 90 minutes. Your baby will usually 
not move during these sleep periods.
